title: Logging stops when syncthing restarts after an automatic update

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Hello,

It seems that when syncthing restarts after an automatic update, the restarted monitor stops writing to stdout. As I stated in https://forum.syncthing.net/t/logging-after-an-automatic-update/5374/5, this seems problematic as automatic updates are frequent, and the logs after such updates can be useful.

In a quick test I ran (launching an outdated `./syncthing`), after the update my terminal goes back to the prompt, while syncthing has correctly restarted and is running in the background.

``` bash
[XXXXX] 08:48:32 INFO: Automatic upgrade (current "v0.11.18" < latest "v0.11.19")
[XXXXX] 08:48:35 WARNING: Automatically upgraded to version "v0.11.19". Restarting in 1 minute.
[XXXXX] 08:49:35 OK: Exiting
[monitor] 08:49:35 INFO: Restarting monitor...
hippo ~/libs $
```

I don't know what it's worth, but I tried to capture the file descriptors associated to the syncthing processes, and it seems that the monitor's standard output after update is pointing to /dev/null:
